item.title: Susie add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Susie add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask whatâ€™s for lunch." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Susie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Susie add a quote by Bill Cosby
item.description: "Let us now set forth one of the fundamental truths about marriage: the wife is in charge." -- Bill Cosby

item.title: Susie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Susie add a quote by Michael Moore
item.description:
"I really didn't realize the librarians were, you know, such a dangerous group. They are subversive. You think they're just sitting there at the desk, all quiet and everything. They're like plotting the revolution, man. I wouldn't mess with them. You know, they've had their budgets cut. They're paid nothing. Books are falling apart. The libraries are just like the ass end of everything, right?
" -- Michael Moore

item.title: Susie add a quote by Monty Python
item.description: "You see, I don't belive that libraries should be drab places where people sit in silence, that has been the main reason for our policy of employing wild animals as librarians." -- Monty Python

item.title: Susie add a quote by Ramona Quimby as written by Beverly Cleary
item.description: "If she can't spell, why is she a librarian? Librarians should know how to spell." -- Ramona Quimby as written by Beverly Cleary

item.title: Susie add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "In life, as in football, the principle to follow is to hit the line hard." -- Theodore Roosevelt
